When an HCR is performed, the VM removes old breakpiont requests.

Later, the breakpoint tries to disable the request and gets the 
InvalidRequestStateException.

We can either handle this by catching the exception (either in the breakpoint 
or in JDI) or by better handling during the HCR. We could remove the 
breakpoint's reference to the request when we "know" the request is gone. This 
is dangerous, though. If a breakpoint event is received for an untracked 
request, we get into a bad state.

Can you reproduce this problem?

I have a fix to our JDIDebugTarget#reinstallBreakpoints() method, but I can't 
be sure that it's working without being able to create the problem.
The breakpoint code has changed drastically since 2.0. Closing.
